result.execSummary:
The defendant Angel M Wilburn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Cause Child <13 to View/Listen Sex. Act., a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.055(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay mandatory DNA surcharge, all other applicable costs , surcharges and assessments.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds and to convert to a civil judgment upon release to Extended Supervision, but remain a condition of Extended Supervision.
*Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain fulltime employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.  Vocational/educational training.
Mental health assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.

No contact with Q.G. or M.A.E.
No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 16 years old.

Sex offender assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.  
Cognitive behavior therapy.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Pursuant to 973.048 defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender register with DOC.  The Court informed defendant that he cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.
Court advised defendant that as  a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms or   body armor and that hemay not vote until civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Cause Child <13 to View/Listen Sex. Act.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angel M Wilburn

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (21 pages) commencing 09/28/15 SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.

Defendant Angel M Wilburn in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Angel M Wilburn in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 97 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  Conditions of extended supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Mental health assesment  and comply with recommended treatment.
*Sex offender asssessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Random urine screens.
*No contact with Q.G. and M.A.E.
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Obtain high school diploma or GED
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*No unsupervised contact with children under the at of 16 years old.
*Pay all costs and surcharges

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision.  

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.
The Court informed the defendant that he cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.

Court ordered restituion set at $0.

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed,
- Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
- Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
jad

On motion of defense, Court ordered presentence investigation. Order for presentence investigation filed; copy to Probation Dept.  
Case adjourned to 7-14-2015 at 8:30 a.m. for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 10.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Defendant Angel M Wilburn in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Angel M Wilburn in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:
State's motion to dismiss and read-in counts 2 and 3 granted by the court.

Attorney Jessica Bellows in court, defendant Angel M Wilburn not in court, in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 10.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angel M Wilburn in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Angel M Wilburn in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Filed, original information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angel M Wilburn in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Angel M Wilburn in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Original Information withdrawn.  Court ordered case adjourned for an Arraignment to Branch 10.  Arraignment scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.

Defendant Angel M Wilburn in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Angel M Wilburn in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  AS TO COUNT 1:  MOTION BY DEFENSE TO AMEND CHARGING SECTION GRANTED BY COURT.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DUGAN, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may quality to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
